summary: Most requirements appear implemented: the app now defaults to an Ahana & Suvo Valentine page, includes a 4-theme selector, floating hearts + particles + confetti with reduced-motion handling, an interactive proposal flow with a “Yes” success state, and updated HTML title/meta. However, some visible sections still address only “Ahana” without also including “Suvo” in the same section, which conflicts with REQ-2.

missing_requirements.requirement: Ensure the names “Ahana” and “Suvo” appear together throughout the Valentine website; no section should display only “Ahana” without also displaying “Suvo” (except where grammatically necessary, with both names still prominent in the same section).
missing_requirements.reason: Some sections/steps contain text and headings that mention only “Ahana” and do not also include “Suvo” prominently within that same section/step.
evidence: frontend/src/components/ProposalStepFlow.tsx (Step 1 title/content: “A Question for Ahana” / “Ahana, you make every day brighter...”; Step 3 content references only Ahana; Step 4 content “So, my dearest Ahana...”)
frontend/src/components/SurpriseReveal.tsx (heading “A Secret Message for Ahana” shows only Ahana in that prominent label, though Suvo appears elsewhere in the component)

hallucinated_features.description: Added an extra/simple proposal page (in addition to the main Valentine page) that is not part of the requested requirements.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest asks to replace the default landing with a Valentine page and add a proposal flow on that page; it does not request creating an additional separate proposal page file.

hallucinated_features.description: Introduced couple photo assets referenced as being displayed on a proposal page.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest does not request adding or using real photos/assets; it focuses on themes, animations, proposal interaction, and branding updates.
